alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hamilton and western Stanton Counties through 230 AM CDT/130 AM MDT/... At 146 AM CDT/1246 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Manter, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Manter around 205 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Johnson City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT/400 AM MDT/ for southwestern Kansas.
